TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DesignerDataSourceView extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for design-time data source view classes.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a custom DesignerDataSourceView object along with a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema> class and two custom <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> classes.
This example is part of a larger sample for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner> class.
[!code-cs[DataSourceDesignerSample#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.d_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[DataSourceDesignerSample#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.d_3_1.vb)] [!code-cs[DataSourceDesignerSample#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.d_3_2.cs)] [!code-vb[DataSourceDesignerSample#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.d_3_2.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceDesigner owner, string viewName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the view in the data source.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified data source designer and view name.
Gets a value indicating whether the object that is associated with the current object supports the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteDelete%2A> method.
Docs.value: if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteDelete%2A> method is supported; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object that is associated with the current object supports the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteInsert%2A> method.
Docs.value: if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteInsert%2A> method is supported; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object that is associated with the current object supports paging through the data that is retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method.
Docs.value: if paging through the data retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method is supported; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object that is associated with the current object supports retrieving the total number of data rows instead of the data itself.
Docs.value: if retrieving the total number of data rows is supported; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object that is associated with the current object supports a sorted view on the underlying data source.
Docs.value: if a sorted view on the underlying data source is supported; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object that is associated with the current object supports the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteUpdate%2A> method.
Docs.value: if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteUpdate%2A> method is supported; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the designer that created this control.
Docs.value: The object provided when the current instance was created.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeData (int minimumRows, out bool isSampleData);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeData(int32 minimumRows, bool isSampleData) cil managed

Docs.param: The minimum number of rows to return.
to indicate that the returned data is sample data; to indicate that the returned data is live data.
Docs.summary: Generates design-time data that matches the schema of the associated data source control using the specified number of rows, indicating whether it is returning sample data or real data.
Docs.returns: A object containing data to display at design time.

remarks.format: ## Examples For a complete example of using the GetDesignTimeData method with views, schemas, and a data source designer, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner>.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the view as provided when this instance of the class was created.
Gets a schema that describes the data source view that is represented by this view object.

remarks.format: ## Examples For a complete example of using the Schema method with views, schemas, and a data source designer, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner>.
